title: Counseling Education for Digital Financial Decision-Making: IT-Supported Process-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of financial products and digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Learners must acquire systematic decision-making processes using IT tools to overcome cognitive limitations in financial product selection

learning_goals: Learners can analyze at least three core risk factors using IT tools when comparing financial products.
After the training, over 80% of learners can construct optimal portfolios using decision-making simulation tools.
Learners can explain the trained decision-making process in real-world financial counseling scenarios in three or more steps.

resources: Online Collaboration Platform (e.g., Zoom, Google Workspace)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
